Reviews.Title: “Small rooms. Helpful staff. Nice breakfast. Clean. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: Airportsfobia
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, specially the ones with one twin bed, they are v small. The rooms we saw had no view. The best was on a small side street. That's normal in this area. Helpful staff, chearful and ready to help and give all the information u need. Nice breakfast. But same menu every day. And again the restaurant is small specially when full you can't get out of your chair if someone is in the chair behind u. Clean hotel. Great location near the tunel by the end of istiklal st.

Reviews.Title: “DelÄ±ghtful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: Excellent Ä±n terms of servÄ±ce, qualÄ±ty, accomodatÄ±ons, food, value, and frÄ±endlÄ±ness. I would defÄ±nately stay here agaÄ±n. The spa features both a sauna and a hanam (TurkÄ±sh bath) and the locatÄ±on Ä±s the best. Surrounded by the busÄ±est area of shops and restaurants. Every restaurant, Ä±ncludÄ±ng that at the hotel, has been excellent. But be advÄ±sed, Ä±f you don't already know, Istanbul Ä±s expensÄ±ve.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect little basic hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ben W
Reviews.Content: I was playing with my band at a club round the corner and we spent two nights at the Pera Rose. The rooms are small, but perfectly nice. The staff are super-friendly and helpful. They didn't even mind when we took over the dining room to record an acoustic session for YouTube while we were waiting for our taxi to leave. Highly recommended. ;)

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel, 5 minutes walking to Istiklal.”
Reviews.Author: Sevisagapo
Reviews.Content: Only location is good. After being to Istanbul there are others better hotels to stay with similar location. Be careful. Don't try to walk to the hotel from istiklal after 23:00 because there no people at all.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; off-season value”
Reviews.Author: ejamtag
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in November 2011 on our way home after two weeks on the Turkish coast. Room was on the small size but was quite clean and had an electric kettle. Good location with easy access to the Pera Museum, Istiklal Cad. and the wonderful street full of mezze restaurants (to the right as you left the hotel). Staff was helpful with airport transfers, arriving and departing.

Reviews.Title: “average”
Reviews.Author: IAEHK
Reviews.Content: We have booked for a double room for 2 nights..Our room at 7th floor was so small, you cannot walk in the room..But bed, water, air condition, breakfast, staff was OK..The hotel place is wonderfull, easy to go Istiklal St, Galata , metro and tunnel..The main problem is NOISE!! Walls are too thin, and when you are at corridor, or when you are waiting the lift you can easily hear noises of your neighbours..I think the hotel does not deserve 4 star, 3 star suits well!

Reviews.Title: “good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: baumkrone
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 days in this hotel and I was satisfied. I booked a single room and got a big triple room with a view at the Golden Horn. The room was very clean and the daily housekeeping was attentive and quite perfect. There was a bottle of vine as complimentary. In the room there was everything you need: electric kettle with free tea and coffee, minibar (quite fair prices), slippers, shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer, sewing kit, nail file, tv with international programmes, etc. The breakfast was good and varied and the staff very friendly and courteous. In the basement of the hotel you can find a small spa with sauna, turkish bath and fitness room. You can also use the spa area at Tulip Hotel (some meters away from Pera Rose) which have sauna, turkish bath, a bigger fitness room, swimming pool and a whirlpool. They offer different massages (fair prices). The hotel is located in an area with lots of bars, restaurants and clubs. It's quite loud on weekends. So if you are sensitive, don't forget earplugs or stay awake and celebrate together with the people on the street. Now some minus points: At the check-in they told me they will block 1 night at the credit card as deposit but they blocked more than the total amount. A bit strange, I think. Internet was free but in need of improvement (sometimes not working or slow). Every day to every 2 days, I had problems with the key card system. This was a bit annoying and I wasn't the only guest who had this problem. All in all I was happy to stay in this hotel and would come again and recommend it. You get a good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location, marred only by a lack of sleep”
Reviews.Author: Gozzies
Reviews.Content: The Pera Rose has a great staff, large, tasty breakfasts, and very good coffee (a must in my book). It is also clean. We stayed here for 3 nights in November as part of a tour and my husband and I had an exterior room (facing the back alley) and our kids had an interior room facing a courtyard or such. The lack of a view didn't bother me, but the nightclub that kicked off in the evening and went until 0400 was unbelievable. Our room was right above the nightclub and with earplugs, I do not exaggerate when I say that the noise was so bad we did not sleep for 2 nights until we got moved to a higher floor on the 3rd night. The staff was very kind and moved us to a higher floor and better room, but it was amazing because it still overlooked the back alley (thus over the nightclub) and we still wore earplugs to sleep! We're pretty laid back when we travel, but sleep is a must, so my recommendation is that if you stay there, MAKE SURE you do not get a room over the nightclub, especially if you have children. At the end of the day, I would stay there again, but I would make sure that specified where I wanted my room to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great beyoglu hotel, super clean, very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Jon S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights, and although there was an initial error with our booking, we had a room with a great view over the Golden Horn. The hotel was very clean, the staff were really nice and friendly, from the front of house staff to the cleaners. For the price, I highly recommend this hotel. The breakfast isn't great, but that's quite standard in Istanbul hotels and I'd recommend heading to Caffe Privato for brunch instead! Would definitely stay in this hotel again if they have space when I return to Istanbul soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bosphorus104
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Fabulous location near Istiklal, restaurants and public transit. Great breakfast & nice staff. Only complaint is noise on weekends. Rooms on upper floors may be better.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and very good location”
Reviews.Author: ismail s
Reviews.Content: To recall our stay at your hotel with my family during the month of July for 3 days is unforgettable and I congratulate you on an exceptionally well run Hotel. I want to express my appreciation and gratitude for the Superior Service received during our stay and wish to thank you for all your kind assistance, co-operation whilst you deserve a great deal of praise for your excellent customer service. The friendliness, courtesy and helpfulness of your Reception Staff Mr. Ibrahim, and all the other Room Service staff ; a words of thanks and praise be given to them, where our room was serviced to a high standard and the facilities were 1st Class, making our stay an enjoyable one. If a chance to be back, without doubt we shall stay at your Hotel â€¦ !!! Thank you once again for an excellent holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but avoid saturday night”
Reviews.Author: vng11
Reviews.Content: It is not my favourite part of Istanbul but as we had spent 4 days in Sultanhamet, we decided to move on the other side of Bosphorus. We booked a standard room in the hotel and had the divine surprise to discover a large suite with a jacuzzi and 2 tv sets, one in the room, the other in the lounge. The hotel is quite comfortable and the staff friendly. The only problem is its location. Surrounded by night-clubs and bars, it is quite noisy on saturday nights. Happily, we had no problem on Sunday and spent a good night. Breakfast buffet is just perfect and you can choose among 6 kind of cheeses to improve your knowledge of this turkish speciality. Really a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its Best”
Reviews.Author: Adel S
Reviews.Content: We loved the location it is in the middle of everything and near many attractions. The room was spacious and chearful, breakfast was grand and came with the room. But the STAFF was the best part. They were very helpfull, catered to our needs, and went out of their way to ensure a pleasant stay . . . always with a big smile, even when the language got in the way. May wife's favorit skert got dirty and she wanted to wear it that night. The problem was it was Sunday and the laundry service at the hotel could not get back to us until Monday. A staff member took it upon himself and found a dry cleaning place that was open and got the skirt cleaned . . . We highly recommend the Pera Rose for your next stay in Istanbul. Dr. & Mrs. Sokkary

Reviews.Title: “It's very good”
Reviews.Author: dktravelchat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pera Rose hotel for 3 nights. On arrival the hotel staff were friendly, helpful and he speaking english. The room it was very clean and bathroom had a nice bath and shower. Breakfast was very very good... i have free internet, free sauna, free turkish hamam and fitness, free parking, and the hotel location was perfect Only problem was that the room its very small... if you stay 2-3 nights, it is not problem.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel: a perfect base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dafosham
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the pera rose for 4 nights whilst attending a conference at Bilgi university. On arrival the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. I was allocated an 8th floor room and all I can say is WOW. We had the most amazing view of the golden horn out of our room window, it was perfect. The room itself was clean and spacious and the bathroom had a lovely shower and bath. Breakfast was adequate with plenty of choices from fruit, yogurt to omelette. The hotel location was perfect and only a short taxi ride away (10 lira) from attractions such as the blue mosque or hagia sophia. It was a quite location off the one of the main streets of Istanbul. There are lots of lovely restaurants, shops and bars within the local vacinity. I would definitely recommend this hotel and it will be my choice if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: krefaat
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is location is perfect; it is at the center of the city with very good facilities. The Hotel staff is friendly and helpful; rooms are clean and obtain all requirements. I really appreciate the treatment and will stay in the same hotel next year. Khaled Refaat

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: daytona22t
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a total of 5 nights in May. First of all, the location is great, just steps away from Istiklal Cadessi and all the great nightlife in and around that area. The hotel is very close to two metro stops (Sisane and Tunel). The wi-fi worked flawlessly during our stay. We always had a strong signal. Our room had a great view of the Golden Horn. The room was not huge, but was clean and comfortable with a double bed and twin bed. The shower was great - plenty of hot water and water pressure. The morning breakfast was very nice. Cheese, olives, fruit, eggs, bread, tea, preserves, juice and coffee were part of the spread. For those who complain about the breakfast, I do not know what you were expecting. Pancakes?? This is Turkey, not Tampa. The hammam was also very clean and reasonably priced. Staff was friendly and helpful. While this hotel lacks frills, it is definitely the best value in the area. We paid under $100/night, which was substantially less than similar hotels on this street. We would definitely recommend this hotel, and will likely stay here again when we return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but so many other countries to visit..........”
Reviews.Author: SilentWanderer
Reviews.Content: What I write is from the perspective of a middle class Indian who has been living in Dubai for many years. The room was like a match box with the double bed occupying most of it. Thankfully the space at the side of the bed was just enough to let me do some simple yoga (although I am six feet tall) ! Room was clean and comfortable despite size, linen was changed regularly (we stayed 3 nights). The AC worked well (being summer we had specifically asked not to be given top floor while booking). The breakfast buffet was great and we used to look forward to it ! Location : fantastic, 1 km from Taksim square, we used to walk up and down Istiklal street, lots of restaurants, grocery stores, great for people watch from a million countries ! Great great value for money, can overlook the room size.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small room!”
Reviews.Author: onatalie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days. All is okay - nice design, even a tea pot in the room, but the room is too small with a view to the wall. No fresh air at all! So, the sleep quality is average.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, good location, friendly crew and people”
Reviews.Author: gazelle188572
Reviews.Content: perfect service for one person a pratical room location is good between a lot of other hotels, restaurants and shoppingstreet nice and good breakfest only the bedmatras was a little bit hard.

Reviews.Title: “Definately average”
Reviews.Author: Robcampenhout
Reviews.Content: After reading all the comments I really had my doubts about the hotel. Coffee and tea making facilities in the room but the used tea bags were never replaced. WiFi for free but slowly. Only one of the reception is friendly the rest were hard to find with a smile. Breakfast is really good, however after 4 days there was little variety. The room we had, had its view of a brick wall. That is why it is a mixture. Then again I have to admit that I left my mobile phone in the room and the day after I called and they still had it saved.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: evpi
Reviews.Content: We went to istanbul 2 weeks ago and stay in Pera Rose Hotel, Great location, We took a junior suite for 3 persons and we found this perfect. The place is excellent to go easily to old and new town. All around we found great restaurants and super place to stay for shopping, take a drink or just for walking. We had massage and scrubing at the hotel was a delicious experience too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnasIbrahim
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the stay at Pera Rose Hotel and the Hotel staff was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kriss18
Reviews.Content: For this price I don't think you can get better - very good value for money. With my friends we stayed in 5 rooms altogether some of which are a bit small and during the the weekends noisy at night due to the bars and clubs in the neighbouring streets - so just get up and go out to join the nightlife! But altogether the rooms are very clean with comfortable beds. It is just opposite to the famous Pera Palace, 2 minutes from Istiklal Street and just 10 minutes from Galata Tower. Taxi drivers usually don't know the hotel (altogether take care with them! once we used 3 taxis for the same direction, 2 drivers asked 15 liras and one asked for the same route 60!!!! ) so you should beter tell them to take you to the Pera Palace ot to Marmara Pera some 50 meters down ont the street.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!!”
Reviews.Author: Elenara_m_88
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in the heart of the city, very nice location... We paid 50 euro per night ... The breakfast was also very nice!! The problem is that most of the receptionists don't speak English! The one double room we had was really small but OK.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay,”
Reviews.Author: Nermeen11111
Reviews.Content: stay in Pera Rose in my honey moon from 13th Jan till 18th Jan i work as a tour operator from Egypt i was always recommend this hotel but the Hotel really deserve to be recommended, the hotel in a quite area in taksim so you can sleep quite & also you can go shopping & have fun in Taksim the stuff very friendly & helpful the restaurant food very yummy the rooms very clean with nice scent logic budget i really recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: alexandra1975
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel 3 nights in the february and i can't find anything to complain about everything was perfectly great ! This is a nice hotel and the staff is Excelent . The hotel includes free wireless internet which worked very well during our stay there. It is near the istiklal street there are lots of restaurant and shoppÄ±ng near by .The room are good size , clean and sea view. See you next time Pera Rose

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel, if you're planning on staying there trust me, DON'T!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sarah600Beirut
Reviews.Content: The location is ALRIGHT, like 7 minutes walk from istiklak street and just around the corner there's a street full of clubs and pucs which is nice... BUUUTTT the staff are sooo rude and mean!! son't believe anyone who says they're nice and helpful!! they made me pay 2 extra nights; 1 night because i checked out 15 minutes late and they made me pay the next night because i didn't notify them of cancellation 24 hours ahead!! as soon as you enter the hotel you are greeted with a sewage smell all over the lobby the rooms smell rotten and the sound of the heater is so loud that you can't even sleep! you can also hear the musics coming from the streets and you hear every single thing going on in the next door rooms. the restaurant is very small and the breakfast is poor, all i ate was cereal! the rooms are tiny! literally tiny!! i booked a double room (for me and my friend) it doesn't even qualify to be a single room; it's a single bed and you can't move around the room, there wasn't any place to put our luggage so we had to keep them on the bed and we put them in the bathroom when we went to sleep... there's no window in the room, the lights are extremely dim so it makes u feel depressed all the time... the bed and pillow are not comfortable at ALLL!!!! i woke up with back and neck pain and i had to do a massage the next day.. there's no wifi in the rooms, and the wifi in the lobby sucks, it keeps disconnecting the fitness room has only 3 machines, you can't evn walk on the treadmill cz it's in a very squeezed corner i had booked for 3 nights but i checked out after night 1 because it was unbareable! There are better hotels on the same street, you can go to Troja Hotel for the same price or you can moce to the Marmara Taksim Hotel which is right on taksim square, close to all the shops and busses and metros.. i stayed at Marmara Taksim it was amazing! they pamper you like no tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service does make a Difference”
Reviews.Author: AM8062
Reviews.Content: I've read the previous reviews and I have to agree with the fact that the standard rooms are not the best possible ones. They are very small. If I were on a vacation, I wouldn't mind at all, since the location is extremely good - and I probably wouldn't spend much time in the room. My travelling agency had booked a standard room for my 4 night business trip. Since I had to spend quite a lot of time in the hotel room working, I would've appreciated a table and a chair. Apparently I didn't make this point clear enought with my agency, so it isn't the hotel's fault that I was accommodated to a room that included only a bed and a minibar.. The hotel's receptionist was extremely understanding and helpfull when I requested over a possibility to change my room for a one with table/chair. On the next day I got a room more suitable for my purposes.. + couple of extra beds and a gorgeus view.. Anyhow, the reason why I wanted to write this review is the fantastic customer service at the hotel. You couldn't ask more - they are very, very friendly and attentative. I will most likely book this hotel in the future as well - before making sure with my agency that they do reserve the room with working facilities.. and if I ever happen to go to Istanbul for vacation, this hotel is definitely on top of my list!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected!!”
Reviews.Author: emeyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pera Rose Hotel in September for 3 nights. We didn't like the hotel for many reasons: The rooms are very small and old, staff are not effecient and unfriendly at all, elevators are small, no wifi in our room (7th floor) and breakfast is avarage. The only thing that we liked about the hotel is that it is near Isteklal street but we have to walk with our children through a street that is full of bars to reach the street.

Reviews.Title: “Mini rooms , but great service”
Reviews.Author: MrsJVAthens
Reviews.Content: People in Turkey are known for their hospitality and great service. Even,hotel its self is not sth special, service is perfect, everyone is very polite, nice and always there for any guest's request. It is funny , but true, rooms are extremly small and without any view:).Personally ,i didn't mind as whole day i was out, exploring The city, but some of other guests did.Breakfast was Ok,bufett style. The position of the hotel is very good, near Taxim sq., easy access to tram, bus & metro stations.( I would sugest to all future visitors to use 'tramvay'( tram) to go around the city as traffic is terrible and taxi driver will try to take advantage of you. Tram is fast,cheap and stops are all over Istanbul). Pera Rose hotel is not for familes with small kids and for people who are looking for leasure.

Reviews.Title: “Room without a view”
Reviews.Author: Andre50
Reviews.Content: The Pera Rose hotel is very comfortable and does a good buffet breakfast, with many fresh and healthy ingredients. Tea and coffee making facilities are available (althoug not free of charge), as is a fridge. The people at the reception are really nice and appreciate any clumsy effort to speak some Turkish words. The only disadvantage of the place is that half the rooms don't have a view, literally no view at all, the window looks out on a tiny inner courtyard, that does not provide any fresh air and hardly any light. The rooms do have however have air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great for 3 people - room with 2 beds plus extra room with comfy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: Cari37
Reviews.Content: Three friends together to visit Istanbul - worked out well to stay here to shop the main street in the evening and eat great food. Easy to get to the old city across the bridge using the tram. Good breakfast and super helpful staff. Definitely use the turkish bath downstairs... if you tell one of the staff you are going down there they will heat up the steam room and sauna for you.

Reviews.Title: “despite booking well in advance they bumped us to the sister hotel down the road”
Reviews.Author: sez41london
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel as it had been recommended by a friend. When we arrived, we were told that there was a water leak and sent us to the Pera Tulip down the road. We think they simply double-booked us, as other people seemed to be checking in. On arrival at the Pera Tulip we were given a twin rather than the double we had booked, and we had to make a fuss to get a double, which was very poky. The staff at both hotels were quite unapologetic so we weren't impressed, and wouldn't recommend either hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: MasaAlexandria
Reviews.Content: first of all : all the stuff was so kind and helpfull when you ask for something or anything, they help you with a kind smile , once you enter the hotel you feel like you are in your own home, rooms are clean, and its place is quiet after a long walk in istanbul and bursa. besides it is sooooo close to Taksim street . Thank you so much for the amazing and wonderful stay in your hotel you deserve the best and we are planning to go there again this year .

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel, room with window next to wall,they stole our money!!!”
Reviews.Author: SofieVdB
Reviews.Content: This was the 11th time i visited Istanbul, so I had some experience with hotels there. Before I stayed in the sister hotel Pera Tulip. What a big difference! The first room we got had a window immediately facing a wall, there was no daylight coming in at all. The room was also very small and not very clean. For 2 days we asked to change to room. Finally they agreed to give us a room 'a bit bigger'. As we emptied the room and the safe we found that 150 Euro was missing from the safe. I immediately contacted reception and they send the manager up. To resume, he said they would do an investigation, this never happened before,... With the card system he could see that maintenance (who can open the safe) had been in our room 2 times the day before, as they said to fix the light. I am 100% sure that somebody from the hotel took that money. As a 'compensation' they moved us to a triple room which was a nice room. But i saw some other double rooms when they were cleaning and they were all very small and with windows facing the wall. If you get this hotel really cheap, maybe this could be an option (then don't put money in the safe), if you have to pay normal rate, please choose another hotel!!! there are much better options then this one. Also i like to mention that there is lots of noise, even nighttime and also from construction sites nearby. Even the hotel said in another review that it's not true, i heard and saw it myself.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ziega
Reviews.Content: we' ve stayed for four nights, i've chosen this hotel based on trip advisor rating and traveler's reviews, and i wasn't disappointed, the rooms were very clean but really small, after the 1st night i asked for changing the room because there were no enough space for our luggage and they politely changed it for us, the staff were very helpful, the breakfast was ok, definitely i would go there again

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SamirNazirov
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Pera Rose tripple room in January 2010 for a week. We were very busy at day time in the city, so left the hotel after breakfast and only came back to hotel late in the evening. Positive sides of the hotel is: - Great location, in the heart of Istanbul, 50 meters to underground metro station ''Sishane'', 10 meters to taxi stop, 50 meters to Istiklal street (many cafe, restaurants, shopes and etc.) - Room was clean, comfortable, furniture and other stuff in the room and hotel itself were in good condition, - Breakfast was good - Hotel Staff at reception was very helpful and friendly - Rooms rates were at a reasonable level Negative sides of the hotel is: - Very poor set of the channels available on room's TV for free. But there is alternative pay TV card costs about 15 US dollars with plenty channels - Room is very small for three adults - Construction near the hotel

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel with several fatal flaws”
Reviews.Author: William009
Reviews.Content: NOISE! There is construction noise on every side of this hotel. One night the hotel outside our window began construction at midnight! We were moved to a less noisy side of the hotel but then we got a twin bed jammed in a regular room (instead of a triple). Hotel would not adjust the rate. Feel ripped off and will have to fight through the credit card system now. Not really up to U.S. standards for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the prize”
Reviews.Author: DuzyMaciek
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and competent service. Very nice room. Great breakfast. Excellent location. Too be honest much more than i expected.

Reviews.Title: “Wait until the construction next door is finished”
Reviews.Author: Acemom3
Reviews.Content: This is a nice boutique hotel that would normally have met all of my expectations. The hotel is well located, has comfortable beds, modern bathrooms, and a very nice daily breakfast. However, there is a building being constructed right next to it and I think many of the rooms share a common wall- ours did. In Istanbul, workmen work very late into the night- after midnight in one case. It sounded like drilling was going on next to our heads and there was no sleeping until it stopped. Once the construction is finished, I would stay here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed at all”
Reviews.Author: thebonami
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a friendly atmosphere. Unfortunately we couldnt say that form the staff. We had a very small room ! I am used to sleep in international hotels, but this was almost a joke. The bed was so small, that i had 3 of my worst nights in a long time. The building next door is under construction, it looked like they stood in my room with their drilling equipement ! The location however is perfect. In the area of TÃ¼nel [5 min walk] are a lot of cosy restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/quality ratio!Cozy and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Precious83
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one week with 2 friends. The location was perfect: very safe area (we are girls),next to taxi station,close to Taksim (centre of the main bus and tram lines),you can also reach both Sultanhamet and Karakoy on foot!Staff was really very kind and ready to help us anytime.Rooms were very clean and comfortable,just they're not very big and there's not a good view....but you can walk out there and next to the hotel there's the bar with the most wonderful view of all istanbul!There's internet connection,but not high speed.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kuskus12002
Reviews.Content: that's the forth and last hotel in my visit in Turkey and without doubt was the best one, it's start from very kind service, location is quite good (not the best, but pretty good and close to taksim, 4 min walk). the rooms are very clean, modren. you have big shower (in our case with Jacuzzi we didn't pay extra for), the bed are comfortable and nice, they have a safe, small gym and a free turkish bath. the price was good as well...very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MartineDLondon
Reviews.Content: We booked a superior room. The room we were allocated was spacious with a separate living room area. It was clean and comfortable. There were building works next door (as per previous reviews), but we couldnâ€™t hear them from our room. The hotel itself is very well located for restaurants, bars etc, being only a 5 min walk from the main shopping street. I would recommend a restaurant called Ponte for the great views - you can google it. I was a bit worried about staying at the Pera Rose after the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, but my fears were unfounded and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and there was a good breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “do not go there!”
Reviews.Author: e0wyn
Reviews.Content: we were supposed to stay there for 2 night, but after the first nigth we have dashed early in the morning. the room given to us was looking to the ventilating shaft! There were windows but not fresh air. The room was more than 30C, since there was no air conditioning,and central cooling/heating. The room was so small and dark , the lightning was not enough, it was overwhelming. Also there were many construction nearby, and we have waken up 7:00am in the morning with the terrible sound of noisy construction machines (feels like they were breaking something with those machines in your head!!). We have stayed at Marmara Pera for the second night and it was just like a dream.. Do not go to Pera Rose unless somebody puts a gun to your head!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: clara82
Reviews.Content: We were a family of 4 adults (2 adult children) traveling and staying here for 1 week. We were so happy to have chosen this hotel, ( based on Trip Advisor reviews). The room was large (2 levels), clean, and very comfortable for 4. The location was perfect, a short pleasant walk to the Tunel end of Istiklal. Yes, it was noisy, but we did not want to sleep past 8 anyway, and I think most everywhere in Istanbul is rather noisy. Closing the window during the night made it no problem then. The staff were so great, particularly the bartender and the day woman at the front desk. The breakfast was very good and plentiful, with many choices. We enjoyed the Hammas, sauna and massage, but were mostly out exploring and enjoying this incredible city, lucky to have had our daughter who had lived there as a guide to many local delights, and ease in using the various public transportations to get everywhere on the European and to the Asian side. We have no negatives, and would highly recommend staying here. We will again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst experience I have ever had!”
Reviews.Author: zzzzzzz1z1z1z1z1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the worst places that I have ever stayed. After arriving at the front desk at 4:15AM after my delayed flight I was told that the room in which I would be staying for most of my trip (I was in Istanbul on business for a week) would not be ready until the next morning so I was put in a different room. I was told that the room to which I would be moved would be â€œmuch nicerâ€�. At 8AM (after 3 hours sleep) the construction noise next door began. It was deafening and literally shook the walls of my room (drilling and jack-hammering). Obviously there was no concern from the staff that I would get almost no sleep that night. I went down to the front desk and told them that they must move me to a different room that was more quiet and that I was ready and re-packed since they had told me the night before that it would be available first thing in the morning. Needless to say it was not and they informed me that I would have to put my bag in storage. After re-packing to accommodate storage of my bag, I finally headed out for work that day completely exhausted. When I returned that evening I picked up my key and went up to my â€œmuch nicerâ€� room. It was horrible. (Either the staff has a very strange idea about what a better room might be or they just simply outright lied to me the night before.) Although it was on a floor that was a little further from the construction it was a room about half the size of my first room AND it had no window to the outside. The only window in the room looked out onto an internal air shaft in the building (no natural light at all). It was completely claustrophobic. I once again went down to the front desk and asked to be moved considering that I was staying for a week and was informed that it would be impossible. Defeated and with no other options I went back to my tomb (oh, I mean room) and began the process of unpacking and trying to find space for my things. After moving the bed over (so that I could accommodate opening the closet door) and having them take away the extra towels, blanket, etc I was finally able to make something work. Then I went to plug in my computer. Although the hotel has wireless (perhaps itâ€™s only plus) the room had only one outlet and it was next to the bed. I literally had no way to charge my computer. I would use it during the morning near the desk (where there was strangely no outlet) and then was unable to leave it out to charge during the day because the outlet was powered only when the key card was placed in itâ€™s slotâ€”and, of course, I had to take the key card with me. I could not plug it in at night because I would have had to put the computer on the bed and would have rolled over on it! So now I was settled in. And to think, why did I bother to bring my travel alarm? How thoughtful of the hotel to arrange for an 8AM construction call to wake me each day! I suppose that this hotel could be good for some people a couple of years from now when the construction is done. As long as you are traveling as more than one person and therefore will not have to stay in the tomb-style closet (I mean room) and require to plug nothing in then you will be fine. . . But if you are staying at Pera Rose anytime soon bring your earplugs!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: luv_city
Reviews.Content: Pera Rose Hotel was a great find, and definitely contributed to us (three girls) having an amazing trip. The staff were incredibly helpful, and the location was great - just round the corner from the main going out/shopping street. It was also very easy to get to the sights during the day. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average experience”
Reviews.Author: STho
Reviews.Content: Positive aspects of this hotel: great breakfast, clean rooms and very close to Istiklal Caddessi- main street wÄ±th cafes,restaurants and shops. Otherwise I am not inclinded to recommend this hotel: the noise is incessant. There is construction right next door and the banging and hammering makes it impossible to take an afternoon nap or sleep in past 7am. At night, there is a popular restaurant and club\bar\disco of sorts right behind the hotel so the loud music and street noise make it hard to have a good night's sleep, especially if you are experiencing severe jet lag. On our second day we requested a different room and we are casually informed that the noise from the construction can be heard anywhere,so it would be pointless to relocate us. The walls are super thin too so you can definitely hear your neighbours conversations & other sounds. As for front desk\concierge help, I have to say that their service is jbelow par. They charged for a city map, cannot provide any useful info wÄ±th regards to sightseeing or using public transport. We got better advice from a clerk at a nearby grocery store! If you must stay at this hotel, ask for an interior room on the highest floor and get a map for free from the airport or prior to hotel arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Very GOOD!!”
Reviews.Author: SamMENTOR
Reviews.Content: I've been a lot of times at the Pera Rose in Istanbul, because from the first time I've been there I loved that hotel. It's a very beautiful, clean and quiet hotel in the middle of the city, with lovely places to visit and where to have a nice walk after dinner. very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: karamitsios
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel during july. everything was very nice the rooms was very beautiful and stylish, though it was really small. it was too clean and the toilet was too clean and nice too. the breakfast was just an average breakfast of a 3-star hotel. there were everything but not bacon and omellete :( the area is safe, and it is about 20-30 metres from istiklal. the location is very good, you have next to you taksim, istiklal, galata tower, galata bridge and many high fahion shops and restaurants. i would definatelly recomd this hotel, though i beleive with some exntensive searvh you can find something a bit better at this price (the price was very low for a hotel like that but i think i could find better) the staff and reception is incredible

Reviews.Title: “My stay in Pera Rose Hotel (jan 2009)”
Reviews.Author: lionelp
Reviews.Content: About Pera Rose Hotel in Istanbul: I was in Istanbul for business, during 3 days, and stayed in the Pera Rose hotel. I made my reservation online, on their website. The positive points are : The atttractive price, the service and the location (near the best restaurants of Beyoglu area). The staff is very nice. Wifi is free everywhere, including the rooms. Sauna and massage are very reasonable, and I really like the small room for fitness. Lots of shops to buy some food at 50 meters from the hotel. They also have a sister hotel called Pera Tulip, more trendy, in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/location”
Reviews.Author: parstraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The staff was very friendly and the breakfast was wonderful. The rooms are a little small, but very clean and updated. Ask to see your room first and try to ask for a larger one; they have them!! Their gym/spa is not much at all, but again you are there to see Istanbul and not workout. Getting to the sites in Sultanahmet by walking took about 20 minutes, but trust me you don't want to be in Sultanahmet at night time. Beyoglu and Istiklal/Taksim are much nicer for night time/dinner. Many Turks themselves hand out in Istiklal/Taksim at night time.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed...”
Reviews.Author: Broadens_the_mind
Reviews.Content: Hmmm, OK, this one was a mixed bag. Main points: - Booked for EUR 50/night - Great location for Pera/Beyoglu/Istiklal St. - Nice people (aren't all the Turks such nice people?) - My room gave onto a concrete wall - no sky at all - but that would have been OK except that it was hellish noisy due (I think) to the aircon gubbins outside on the roof (I was on the top floor). Also, the aircon unit in the room did that annoying wheezing & gurgling thing every hour or two. - Next day they moved me to another room, with a bit of an outside (if not scenic) view. Again the aircon was noisy, so I turned it off. Had to keep the window closed cos of the noise on the street, so the room was stuffy. As a result I didn't sleep well any of the 3 nights I was there. - Free wifi was fast enough & reasonably reliable. - Rather than lend me an iron, they charged my EUR 5 to iron a shirt, which I thought pricey in Turkish terms. Next time, if I want the same location (I probably will), I'll probably search for some other places and only book this place again if I can't find anything else promising.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good For The Money”
Reviews.Author: TheLondonGuy
Reviews.Content: The Pera Rose is small Hotel in a side street off the main shopping street (Istiklal) which is full of restaurants, bars and modern shops. In fact it is one of the busiest atmospheric streets that Iâ€™ve ever seen in the world, inc. Times Square. The street that the Hotel is in looks a bit â€˜seedyâ€™ with some construction work going on (inc. renovating the Hotel The Pera Rose Palace used by Orient Express guests built 1892â€™s), but the street is quite safe as much of Istanbul is. The streets near the hotel can be quite noisy if you have your window open. All the Hotel staff speak some English and are very friendly. The two lifts are very small, only holding three persons each, but they do the job. The rooms I saw were not over generous in size, but were in a good state of repair. I had a nice view of the Bosporus. The rooms had Air-Con (although mine was not highly effective) a safe, a bathroom with a nice shower (but low pressure) a kettle, mini-bar and TV. You will need to buy extra tea, coffee and milk powder in a local shop if you like more than two cups per day. Most of the TV programmes were in the Turkish language, but hey I was in Turkey! The room was exceptionally dark at night and lacked enough lighting, like most hotel rooms do. An attractive multi purpose room off the foyer (Restaurant/Breakfast room/Bar) was also a little too dark; however I suppose they would call it atmospheric. The continental breakfast buffet was very good and included cold meats, yoghurts, bread, cereal, Hard-boiled eggs, sausage and occasionally scrambled egg. The wardrobe space and number of coat hangers was pretty limited. The lock on the hotel door had an alarm if it was not latched properly which sounds like a good idea. However, it was prone to going off too often. The bed was very comfortable. Many of the historic sites are reached via the â€˜Venicularâ€™ (to Tunnel) which is a short walk from the hotel, then crossing the Galata Bridge by tram, which are modern and cheap. Taxi's are pretty good value too. Donâ€™t miss the Topkapi Palace, Basilica Cistern and Hagia Sophia. The Bosphorus Ferry-cruise (six hours) is good too. Do avoid the Hotel's recommended Fish restaurant under the Galta Bridge â€“ it is of poor quality and very overpriced. Generally Istanbul food is very good value. The whole Hotel experience and location was not five star, arguable not four star either (in the conventional sense) but it was certainly very good for the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Dark room and moldy shower!”
Reviews.Author: cooltravelers40
Reviews.Content: Dark room and moldy shower. We reserved a room with queen size bed through Expedia and when we arrived they gave us a room double room with 2 twin beds. The bathroom had mold in the shower. We showed them our room confirmation from Expedia which specified 1 queen size bed. They then gave us a room with double bed. The shower in this had MOLD too! They said that they didn't have anymore room with queen size bed and that they only had 2 rooms left (one with 2 single beds or the other with 1 double bed) - basÄ±cally they gave all qeen size bed rooms other guests who checked-in earlier (we checked-iÄ±n at about 4pm and they were out of queen size bed rooms!). We were very unhappy with the cleaniless of the room and not being given the room we reserved.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: StarBrigt7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located. The rooms are clean, albeit small. The beds aren't comfortable, but you shouldn't be sleeping too much while you're on vacation in a city as great as Istanbul anyway. There's free wifi in the hotel which is great. There's also a free breakfast buffet from 7 to 10 which is surprisingly great. Additionally, there's a good beauty parlor just around the corner and great shops and dining w/in walking distance. I'd definitely stay at the Pera Rose again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: emekli
Reviews.Content: It is a nice little boutique hotel, close to many places.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: Elisavet24
Reviews.Content: Location: Ideal, next to the main road and in the area with all the cafes, bars and restaurants. Great starting point to explore the city too.. Initially, I was advised to look for hotels in Taksim area, as this is considered "the centre", but I am glad I did not. Taksim Square is not worth it!! Rooms: Great ambience and comfort (some with Bosphorus view) Price: 79 euro per night, DBL BB, including free use of hamam facilities Service: Above average General tips: Be VERY careful with what you eat and drink..!! Even though we always had mineral water and ate in good restaurants, we got gastrenteritis!! Turks do NOT speak English! ..and sometimes they speak Turkish and laugh at your face!! Some taxi drivers overcharge.. Do NOT visit a public hamam..the most disgusting experience ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly but noisy Saturday night”
Reviews.Author: Backpack1999
Reviews.Content: The Pera Rose is in a great location, about 10 minutes walk from Taskim Square or a 20 minute walk to the Bazaar Quarter (downhill that is!). The check-in staff spoke good English and we had good fun watching a Euro 2008 match with the barman in the hotel's bar. The room was pretty standard but of a good size and had an amazing view (we were staying on the 7th floor overlooking the Bosphorus). The ONLY downside was that the Saturday night we stayed there was an outside terrace bar opposite the hotel which was booming out trance music until 3am. The windows were double glazed and even still it was like a stereo was playing in the room. We called reception who didn't seemed surprised by the music and said it would be finished by 2am. This could have been a one off night or could happen every Saturday. It certainly didn't spoil our stay. However, if you are noise sensitive I would probably avoid this one or check whether that is a regular Saturday night gig.

Reviews.Title: “great breakfast, easy access to young nightlife”
Reviews.Author: reprof
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff in the breakfast room and at the bar. Nicely appointed rooms can be small and some on airshafts are dark. Excellent breakfast, among the best I had in Turkey. Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, major museums are a vintage underground train and then streetcar ride away, maybe 20 minutes or so. Young nightlife and cafes are a couple of minutes walk away. Two new computers with flat screen monitors available to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: megsyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pera Rose in April/May, 2008 for 7 nights. Staff were friendly and very helpful, and with good English skills. My twin room was on the second floor, at at the back, which made it a bit noisy at weekends, but fine during the week. Friends on upper floors had less noise. Room size was adequate, but I was shown the rooms with a queen bed, without an external window, which seemed a little claustrophic. Bathroom was good, with hot shower, half bath, and great water pressure. Mini fridge in the room, and small LCD TV. Breakfasts were great. Large spread of options. Location was handy both for Taxim and the conference centre (7 Lira one way taxi trip, or 35 minute walk), and the old city, which was also easily walkable (or could walk to Galata and take the tram), but the hills on the return trip were a challenge! Area felt safe, even at night. Lots of bars, restaurants, and cafes within close proximity. Staff also took great care when my stay coincided with May Day marches to ensure that any difficulties or trouble was avoided, which was appreciated. They also came to the rescue of others in our traveling group whose accommodation booking was not honoured elsewhere. I would stay here again, but would request a room higher up in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ASO82
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in mid-February. Paid Â£52 per night on Expedia UK. I always take the view that if I like a hotel, then I will return there, and the Pera Rose is a hotel that I would stay in again. Great location! In a quiet street a couple of minutes walk to Istiklal Cadessi (Street). No outside noise could be heard at all! As a boutque hotel it's not the largest, but it is very nice. Reception area is very well mainted at all times and the staff are friendly. Restaurant is very nice and again, the staff there are extra helpful and friendly. I had a standard double room. Room size is ok, can easily accomodate 2 people and luggage. Flat screen TV on the wall (although some channels were not accessible). Bathroom was pretty small however though. Only room for 1 person at a time in there. there were some aging marks in the room; frayed carpet, crack in bathroom tiles, but nothing major. Free wireless Internet throughout your stay. I was on the 8th floor and I managed to pick up a decent signal in my room so you don't always have to use their Business Centre to check your emails etc... The health-spa was nice. Although I didn't get the chance to try any of the offerings available, it all looked very well maintained. The actual Fitness Suite leaves a little to be desired though. Only the two exercise machines there and some free-weights, so don't book this hotel on the basis of their fitness suite. Only real downside to this hotel is funnily enough the level of light. The room, restaurant and most other places seemed to be kind of dark and could do with a few extra lightblubs here and there. Only other gripe was that every time I left the hotel, sitting outside was a child trying to get me to give him money by weighing myself. It is Istanbul and this happens in many other places but it did become annoying every time I ventured near the hotel.
